mainEntity.name: Which Shopify report is best for getting the raw numbers for my AOV calculation?

acceptedAnswer.text: The 'Sales over time' report in your Shopify Analytics is the gold standard. It gives you the two numbers you need: total sales and the total number of orders for any given period.

mainEntity.name: Beyond AOV, what other metrics give the best context on customer value?

acceptedAnswer.text: You absolutely have to look at Customer Lifetime Value (CLV) and Purchase Frequency. AOV tells you what a customer spends now, but CLV tells you what they're worth over their entire relationship with your brand.

mainEntity.name: How does segmenting my customers actually change my AOV insights?

acceptedAnswer.text: Segmenting is everything. A blended, store-wide AOV might be $80. But when you segment, you might find that new customers have an AOV of $60 while returning customers have an AOV of $110. Without segmentation, that crucial detail is completely hidden.

@graph.name: Average Order Value (AOV)
@graph.description: The average dollar amount a customer spends every time they place an order on your store over a specific period

@graph.name: Customer Lifetime Value (CLV)
@graph.description: The total long-term value of a customer calculated as AOV x Purchase Frequency x Customer Lifespan

@graph.name: Upselling
@graph.description: Persuading a customer to buy a more expensive version of a product

@graph.name: Cross-selling
@graph.description: Suggesting related or complementary items to customers

@graph.name: Product Bundling
@graph.description: Grouping related products together and selling them as a single package, usually at a slight discount

@graph.name: Post-Purchase Offer
@graph.description: An offer presented after checkout is complete when the customer's payment info is already stored
